bibl.title: Letter from E.S. Pillsbury to Mabel H. Lazear, April 17, 1908

div1.p: Pillsbury informs Mabel Lazear that he supports her pension and encloses a copy of the letter he sent to Senators Perkins and Flint.

div1.head: Letter from E.S. Pillsbury to Mabel H. Lazear, April 17, 1908
div1.opener:
LAW OFFICES OF
PILLSBURY, MADISON & SUTRO
KOHL BUILDING
---------------
E. S. PILLSBURY
FRANK D. MADISON
ALFRED SUTRO
HORACE D. PILLSBURY
OSCAR SUTRO
----
Cable Address “EVANS” W.U.T. Code
Subject
SAN FRANCISCO April 17, 1908
Mrs. Mabel H. Lazear,
218 Padre St.,
Santa Barbara, Cal.
Dear Mrs. Lazear:-
div1.p:
Referring to your letter concerning an increase
of pension: Herewith please find the copy of a letter which
I have sent directly to Senator Perkins on the subject, and
have also mailed copy of the same to Senator Flint and the
members of Congress from this State. I hope this action may
do some good.

I intended to write sooner, but have been unavoid-
ably kept away from my office for the last two weeks.

Edith writes me that she contemplates returning to
California next autumn.
div1.closer: Yours very respectfully, E S Pillsbury Enc.
